required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Behavior Enhances Drug Reduction of Incontinence (BE-DRI)
clinical_study.official_title: Behavior Enhances Drug Reduction of Incontinence

collaborator.agency: Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of this study is to test if the addition of behavioral treatment to drug therapy for the treatment of urge incontinence will increase the number of patients who can discontinue drug therapy and sustain a significant reduction of incontinence.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Women Who Meet Definition of Success
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of women who meet definition of success: not taking drug or receiving other urge UI therapy (i.e., neuromodulation, botox injections, myomectomy, electrical stimulation, or any intravesical therapy) and not taking a tricyclic antidepressant or duloxetine at 8 months; and a >70% reduction in number of incontinence episodes as compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline to 10 weeks in number of incontinence episodes per week as reported on bladder diary.
Change from baseline to 10 weeks in frequency of voids per day as reported on bladder diary
Urogenital distress inventory (UDI). Higher score indicates greater distress. Possible range 0 to 300.
Disease specific overactive bladder scale (OAB-q). HIgher score indicates greater bother. Possible range 0 to 100.
Number of women who responded "completely satisfied" to question, "How satisfied are you with your progress?"
Number of women who responded "completely satisfied" to question "How satisfied are you with your progress?"
Number of women who responded "much better" or "better" to question: "Overall, do you feel that you are much better, better, about the same, worse or much worse?"
Number of women who responded "much better" or "better" to question: "Overall, do you feel that you are much better, better, about the same, worse or much worse?"

arm_group.description: Women randomly assigned to this condition receive 10 weeks of anti-cholinergic medication (tolterodine) and behavioral training.
Women assigned to this arm received 10 weeks of anti-cholinergic medication (tolterodine), only.

intervention.description: 4mg/d for 10 weeks. Could be reduced to 2mg/d for managing side effects.

Training in pelvic floor muscle control and exercises; behavioral strategies to diminish urgency, suppress bladder contractions and prevent incontinence; delayed voiding; and individualized fluid management.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion:
- Female
- Urge predominant incontinence
- Incontinent > 3 mos
- Available for 8 mos of followup
Exclusion:
- Pregnancy or < 6 mos post-partum
- Hypersensitivity to drug (tolterodine)
- Systemic disease that affects bladder function (e.g., Parkinson's disease, Multiple Sclerosis, spinal cord injury)
- History of extensive behavior treatment

facility.name: University of Texas Health Sciences Center

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Between July, 2004 and January, 2006 4,043 women were screened for eligibility and 561 provided written consent. After further screening, 134 were found to be ineligible, 119 withdrew consent and 1 was excluded erroneously. The remaining 307 were randomized to one of the treatment arms.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 134 found to be ineligible after consent, for 77 their urinary incontinence (UI) was not urge predominant, 19 had fewer than 7 episodes of incontinence per week and the other 38 were excluded for a variety of reasons.

group.description: Women randomly assigned to this condition receive 10 weeks of anti-cholinergic medication and behavioral training.

group.description: Women assigned to this arm received 10 weeks of anti-cholinergic medication, only.

group.title: Total

outcome.title: Proportion of Women Who Meet Definition of Success
outcome.description: Proportion of women who meet definition of success: not taking drug or receiving other urge UI therapy (i.e., neuromodulation, botox injections, myomectomy, electrical stimulation, or any intravesical therapy) and not taking a tricyclic antidepressant or duloxetine at 8 months; and a >70% reduction in number of incontinence episodes as compared to baseline.
outcome.population: All women who completed the 8 months assessment or were known to return to drug use prior to that time.

group.title: Combination Therapy
group.description: Women randomly assigned to this condition receive 10 weeks of anti-cholinergic medication and behavioral training.

group.title: Drug Therapy Alone
group.description: Women assigned to this arm received 10 weeks of anti-cholinergic medication, only.

measure.title: Proportion of Women Who Meet Definition of Success
measure.description: Proportion of women who meet definition of success: not taking drug or receiving other urge UI therapy (i.e., neuromodulation, botox injections, myomectomy, electrical stimulation, or any intravesical therapy) and not taking a tricyclic antidepressant or duloxetine at 8 months; and a >70% reduction in number of incontinence episodes as compared to baseline.
measure.population: All women who completed the 8 months assessment or were known to return to drug use prior to that time.

analysis.groups_desc: Kaplan Meier Lifetable analysis was used to compute the 8 month cumulative success rates.

outcome.title: Change in Incontinence Episodes
outcome.description: Change from baseline to 10 weeks in number of incontinence episodes per week as reported on bladder diary.
outcome.population: All women with valid bladder diary at baseline and 10 weeks in each treatment group.

group.title: Combination Therapy
group.description: Women randomly assigned to this condition receive 10 weeks of anti-cholinergic medication and behavioral training.

group.title: Drug Therapy Alone
group.description: Women assigned to this arm received 10 weeks of anti-cholinergic medication, only.

measure.title: Change in Incontinence Episodes
measure.description: Change from baseline to 10 weeks in number of incontinence episodes per week as reported on bladder diary.
measure.population: All women with valid bladder diary at baseline and 10 weeks in each treatment group.

analysis.groups_desc: Test of hypothesis of no difference in change in episodes between the two groups.
analysis.p_value_desc: Mixed effect repeated measures analysis of variance controlling for study site.

outcome.title: Change in Voids Per Day
outcome.description: Change from baseline to 10 weeks in frequency of voids per day as reported on bladder diary
outcome.population: All women with valid bladder diary at baseline and 10 weeks in each treatment group.

group.title: Combination Therapy
group.description: Women randomly assigned to this condition receive 10 weeks of anti-cholinergic medication and behavioral training.

group.title: Drug Therapy Alone
group.description: Women assigned to this arm received 10 weeks of anti-cholinergic medication, only.

measure.title: Change in Voids Per Day
measure.description: Change from baseline to 10 weeks in frequency of voids per day as reported on bladder diary
measure.population: All women with valid bladder diary at baseline and 10 weeks in each treatment group.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis of no difference between arms in change in number of voids per day from baseline to 10 weeks.
analysis.p_value_desc: Repeated measures ANOVA controlling for clinical site.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference (group 1 - group 2) in change from baseline to follow-up in voids per day.

outcome.description: Urogenital distress inventory (UDI). Higher score indicates greater distress. Possible range 0 to 300.
outcome.population: All women who completed UDI at each time in each treatment group

measure.title: Symptom Distress
measure.description: Urogenital distress inventory (UDI). Higher score indicates greater distress. Possible range 0 to 300.
measure.population: All women who completed UDI at each time in each treatment group

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis is that there is no difference between treatment groups in improvement in UDI over time
analysis.method_desc: Main hypothesis tested by F-test for treatment by time interaction (2 and 509 degrees of freedom). No parameters estimated.

outcome.population: Participants who completed OAB-q assessment at each time in each treatment group.

analysis.groups_desc: Repeated measures analysis of difference in symptom bother over time by treatment group.

measure.title: Satisfaction
measure.description: Number of women who responded "completely satisfied" to question, "How satisfied are you with your progress?"
measure.population: Number of women who completed satisfaction question at 10 weeks.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: no difference in satisfaction at 10 weeks
analysis.method_desc: Controlling for clinical site and randomization stratum
analysis.estimate_desc: Ratio of odds of complete satisfaction in Combination therapy arm to Drug only arm.

reported_events.time_frame: Participants were monitored for adverse events throughout the study period (8 months).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Ony 68% of participants completed assigned treatment.
